intro: Bulbocodium vernum f. plantii, commonly known as the spring bulbocodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. It is typically found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
